>
[Glass Cutter](/Equipment.aspx?ID=870)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [PFS Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=50) pg. 115

**Price** 5 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Hands** 2

**Bulk** L
</row>

**Access** Member of the Pathfinder Society.

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This small rod has a tiny, sharp cutting wheel made of steel on one end and a thick bulb on the other. You can use the glass cutter's wheel to score ordinary glass and use the bulb to break the piece along your scoring. It typically takes 1 minute of work to cut a hole large enough to fit your hand. If you are attempting to break the glass quietly, you must attempt a [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=17) check against the Perception DC of nearby creatures to go unnoticed.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
